pois.name: The Old Wall
pois.description: As a tiny mouse scurrying across the campus of Spring Hill College, I couldn't help but notice a beautiful and tranquil space nestled among the trees. It was the Marian Grotto, a serene devotional site dedicated to the Virgin Mary.

pois.name: Marian Grotto
pois.description: As I approached the Grotto, I marveled at the verdant ivy that cascaded down the stone facade, creating a peaceful atmosphere that soothed my tiny mousey soul. The sound of the breeze, the chirping of the birds, and the rustling of the ivy’s tendrils created a symphony of nature that surrounded the Grotto.

pois.name: The Virgin Mary
pois.description: But it wasn't just the natural beauty that drew my attention. The Grotto was adorned with a beautiful statue of the Virgin Mary, standing proudly and majestically in the center of the space. The white marble of her robes gleamed in the sunlight, while the intricate details of her face and hands seemed to bring her to life.

pois.name: Tunnel of Intentions
pois.description: I could feel the reverence and respect that the students and visitors had for this sacred space as they came to offer prayers, which were channeled up towards the figure of Mary. It was clear that the Grotto held a special place in the hearts of those who visited it.

pois.name: Leaving the Grotto
pois.description: As I scurried back into the bushes, I couldn't help but feel a sense of peace and contentment that lingered long after I left the Grotto. Even as a tiny mouse, I knew that the Marian Grotto was a significant and beautiful part of Spring Hill College - once a wall that bordered the campus, now a monument of the school’s Jesuit community.
